data.title: Archdiocese of Oklahoma City
data.text:
The Printable Resource List document is compiled by Catholic Charities of OKC and contains the contact information for area agencies that provide resources.

CLOTHING/ROPA

Care for OKC

Open Monday evenings from 4:30 pm - 6:30pm.

To receive assistance, clients must bring an ID and Proof of Residence (examples of proof include: a utility bill, a rent receipt, or another piece of mail).

We are currently able to provide services to people living in the following zip codes:

73102, 73103, 73104, 73105, 73106, 73107, 73108, 73118

Christian Service Center

Open 9am – 2 pm Monday through Friday

Infant Crisis Services

Infant Crisis Services provides formula, food, diapers, blankets, clothing, and other basic necessities by appointment. Please call (405) 528-3663 to schedule an appointment. These services are available four times annually to children birth – age 3.

Jesus House WareHouse

Sister BJ's Pantry

Food, Clothing, Transitional Housing, Coats for the Homeless

Skyline Urban Ministry

Affiliated with the United Methodist Church, Skyline provides free and low-cost assistance to children, families and senior citizens. The organization provides clothing, meals and emergency food, eye care and eyeglasses and other support services.

Yukon Sharing Ministry

Yukon Sharing Ministry provides food, clothing, limited utility assistance, prescriptions, gasoline for a job search, limited rental assistance, and referral to other agencies. Emergency shelter is available.

COUNSELING / CONSEJERÍA

Catholic Charities

Crossings Community Clinic

Sunbeam Family Services

Counseling Solutions

Transformation Christian Counseling

Red Rock Behavioral Services

Northcare

DENTAL CLINICS / CLÍNICAS DENTALES

College of Dentistry

Good Shepherd Ministries

Neighborhood Services

DIAPERS / PAÑALES

All Things Baby

Open Tuesdays 10am - 1pm

ALWAYS BE SURE TO CALL BEFORE YOU MAKE THE DRIVE- 405-285-6245

Family Expectations

Infant Crisis Center

DOMESTIC VIOLENCE/VIOLENCIA DOMÉSTICA

Abuse Reporting Hotline 1-800-522-3511

La Luz Org

Services assisting with help for domestic violence, sexual assault, trauma, and stalking

Oklahoma Coalition Against Domestic Violence

Palomar Justice Center

We partner with other community agencies to provide wraparound services to victims of domestic violence, child abuse, sexual assault, stalking, elder abuse, and human trafficking.

Statewide and Local Domestic Violence Resources

Compiled by Legal Aid Services

YWCA Domestic Violence Help

EMPLOYMENTTRAINING / ENTRENAMIENTO de EMPLEO

AARP

City Rescue Mission

Call Us 24/7 (405) 232-2709

Reaching Our City

Suited for Success

Women's Clothing for Work

Clients are scheduled by appointment only.

Urban League

Work Ready

TEEM Education and Employment Ministry

ENGLISH CLASSES / CLASES DE INGLÉS OCCC

OCCC

JUMP Academy

English classes and citizenship

FOOD PANTRIES / ALMACÉN DE COMIDA

First Baptist Church – Care For OKC

Mondays 4:30-6:30 pm

Good Shepherd Ministries

Jesus House

Food pantry M/W/F, 8:30am – 12pm Meals served weekdays, Breakfast 8am, lunch 12:30pm, & dinner 5pm; weekend: brunch 10am, dinner 4:30pm (During Covid, only serving at 4:30 daily)

Mid-Del Food Pantry

Mission Mid-Del

Tuesdays and Fridays from 10:00 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. or until 80 tickets have been distributed

Reaching Our City

Thursdays & Fridays 10 am to 11:30 am and 1 pm to 2:30 pm

Regional Food Bank

FOOD BANK LOCATOR!

Salvation Army

Samaritan House

Sister BJ's Pantry

Food, Clothing, Transitional Housing, Coats for the Homeless

Skyline Urban Ministry

St. Vincent de Paul Food Pantries

The Dorothy Day Center

Assist Handicapped, Disabled, No Transportation, Delivery to homebound (NW)

Yukon Sharing Ministry

Yukon Sharing Ministry provides food, clothing, limited utility assistance, prescriptions, gasoline for a job search, limited rental assistance, and referral to other agencies. Emergency shelter is available.

FURNITURE / MUEBLES

Salvation Army

Hope Chest

Hope Chest exclusively provides Beds, Bedding, Dining Tables/Chairs

Infant Crisis Center

HOUSING / VIVIENDA

City Care / Pershing Center

Transitional housing, low income, homeless- NO CHILDREN

Grace Home

Home for pregnant women

Habitat for Humanity

Heart and Hand Ministries

Transitional Housing, Women with children ONLY

Homeless Alliance

housing for veterans and people who are chronically homeless

Neighborhood Services Organization

Transitional housing for families with multiple children, pregnant women, young men

OK Community Cares

Support for people at risk of losing their home due to financial crisis

OKC Housing Authority

Public housing, section 8

Rose Home

Home for Pregnant Women

Sanctuary Women's Development Center

Sunbeam Family Services

Seniors only

Urban League

HUMAN TRAFFICKING/TRATA DE PERSONAS

The Dragonfly Home

Through the non-residential services, The Dragonfly Home serves women and men who have been exploited in sex trafficking, labor trafficking, or both. In some situations, The Dragonfly Home serves youth victims of human trafficking, as well

IDs / IDENTIFICACIÓN

Guild of St. George

food, help with utility bills, bus tokens, and deposits for public housing and assists with medical prescriptions, Oklahoma identification cards and birth certificates.

Social Security Office

Upward Transitions

Need referral (see website for how to get a referral)

LEGAL SERVICES / SERVICIOS LEGALES

Catholic Charities

Immigration Cases ONLY / Casos de inmigración SOLAMENTE

Legal Aid

Free or low cost services to eligible low income people, and senior citizens.

OK Indian Legal

Good Shepherd Ministries

Medical/dental M/T 4:30-7:00pm

Healing Hands Medical Care for Homeless

Healing Hearts Clinic

Providing free medical care for those in need. Call to make an appointment. (405) 737-4441

See website for application

Indian Health Services

CLINIC LOCATOR

MENTAL HEALTH / SALUD MENTAL

National Suicide Prevention Lifeline

Hours: Available 24 hours. Languages: English, Spanish.

800-273-8255

Catholic Charities

Crossings Community Clinic

Nami Helpline 800-950-6264 Text: Nami to 741741

PREGNANCY/EMBARAZO

Catholic Charities Adoption Service

​​​​​​​Pregnancy counseling, adoption counseling before and after placement, home visits if needed, assistance in choosing and meeting a family for placement, planning hospital stay, determining how much contact you want after placement, transportation to doctor’s appointments, case management, limited financial assistance

Eden Clinic

limited ultrasounds, women's wellness, sti testing

​​​​​​​GoLife Norman

pregnancy tests, limited ultrasound

​​​​​​​​​​​​​​Infant Crisis Center

Rose Home

Shelter for homeless pregnant women

Willow Pregnancy Support

pregnancy tests, limited ultrasound, prenatal vitamins, prenatal care

PRESCRIPTIONS / RECETAS MEDICAS

​​​​​​​Community Action

The program provides only long-term medications, such as insulin for diabetes, not for short-term needs.

Guild of St. George

food, help with utility bills, bus tokens, and deposits for public housing and assists with medical prescriptions, Oklahoma identification cards and birth certificates.

OK County Pharmacy

Rx for Oklahoma

Samaritan House

Grace Rescue Mission

Shelter

​​​​​​​Catholic Charities

bus passes provided with a verified appointment

HOMELESS WITH REFERRAL ONLY
